prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.3234]. Step 2: Sketch Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1. Draw line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.0] 2. Draw line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.375] 3. Draw line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.375], ending at [0.0, 0.375] 4. Draw line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.375], ending at [0.0, 0.0] This sketch consists of a single face, which has a single loop (loop_1) with four lines. Step 3: Extrusion Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.0141 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. Part 2: Cylindrical Object Step 1: Coordinate System Re-use the same coordinate system as in Part 1. Step 2: Sketch Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw two rectangles and two arcs to create the cylinder's top-right quadrant. 1. Face 1 (Top) 1. Loop 1 1. Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.0141, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Starting at [0.0141, 0.0], ending at [0.0141, 0.0141]. 3. Line 3: Starting at [0.0141, 0.0141], ending at [0.0, 0.0141]. 4. Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0141], ending at [0.0, 0.0]. 2. Face 2 (Bottom) 1. Loop 1 1. Line 1: Starting at [0.7359, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.0141]. 3. Line 3: Starting at [0.75, 0.0141], ending at [0.7359, 0.0141]. 4. Line 4: Starting at [0.7359, 0.0141], ending at [0.7359, 0.0]. 3. Face 3 (Arc connecting top and bottom-right side) 1. Loop 1 1. Arc: Starting at [0.0141, 0.0], ending at [0.7359, 0.0], with a center point at [0.0141, -0.0141]. 4. Face 4 (Arc connecting top and bottom-left side outside the cylinder) 1. Loop 1 1. Arc: Starting at [0.0141, 0.3609], ending at [0.7359, 0.3609], with a center point at [0.0141, 0.375]. Step 3: Extrusion Extrude the top and bottom rectangle faces by 0.3234 opposite the normal while keeping the arcs to a depth of 0. Final shape Combine part 1 and part 2 using the "JoinFeatureOperation", resulting in the final shape, which is a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one side. The cutout is achieved through the intersection of part 1 and part 2.</description>
